text:
Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another
Nerdy Nummies!
Ro: Today I have a very special guest, Austin!
Austin: What up guys!

Ro: OK, Austin, I’m so excited, what’s
going on with you? What’s new?

Austin: Well I have a new single out, it’s
called Dirty Work, Ro: Mmmhmm.

Austin: And you should go check it out because
it’s a lot of fun!
Ro: I loved it! Austin: And you should download it.

Ro: I did download it! Austin: Did you? Ro:
Yeah! Austin: OK, alright!

Ro: I loved it, I’ll put links down below
so you can go check it out.

Ro: And I’ll be putting all of Austin’s
links on social media. Austin: Yes!

Ro: So go say hi to him. Austin: Go follow
me!

Ro: So, do you bake a lot. Austin: No I do
not.
Ro: I will teach you, don’t you worry.

Ro: And, do you watch any My Little Ponies?
Austin: No, no I do not.
Ro: Don’t worry, I’ll help you! Austin: OK, thank you so much!

Ro: I’ll teach you the ways of MLP. I got
so many requests from you guys to

Ro: make something My Little Ponies related.
Austin: Awesome.

Ro: So that is what we’re gonna be doing
today! We are gonna be making
Ro: Mrs. Cake Cutie Mark Cupcakes!
Both: Let’s get started!

Ro: The things you will need, will be: A white
cake recipe, I’m

Ro: using the official Nerdy Nummies recipe,
but we are gonna tweak it a little bit

Ro: because we’re gonna be using a little
bit of fresh cherry juice.

Ro: So, you will need: 2 cups flour, 1-1/2
cups sugar, Maraschino Cherries,

Ro: 5 egg whites, 1 sh-tick of butter, 1/2
a cup of milk, 1/4 cup of vegetable

Ro: shortening, 1/4 teaspoon of almond extract,
2 teaspoons of baking powder,

Ro: a pinch of salt, and 2 teaspoons of vanilla
extract.

Austin: You will also need, 2 mixing bowls,
1 mixer, some cupcake trays

Austin: and some liners. Ro: That’s right!
Austin: Preferably gold! Ro: Yeah!
Ro: Now let’s. Both: Put it all together!

Ro: The first thing that we’re gonna do
is whisk together some of our dry ingredients.

Ro: So Austin, you’re gonna add the flour
in the bowl. Austin: Ok, here we go.

Austin: Flour’s in the bowl. Ro: Boom! Austin:
Boom!

Ro: And, a little bit on the finger, just
for a little good luck. Austin: Boom!

Ro: And, baking powder, and a pinch of salt.
Will you give me a pinch?
Austin: Little pinch. Ro: There you go!

Austin: OK. Ro: Are you ready? Austin: OK.
Ro: I’m gonna have you whisk, and then

Ro: I’m just gonna whisk and nay-nay over
here!
Austin: Mmm-mmm-mmm-mmm-mmm-mmm! Ro: Mmm! Mmmm-mmm-mmm!

Ro: Now that we’ve got that together we’re
gonna cream our butter and shortening.

Ro: So I’m gonna do this, because this is,
this is the dirty work!

Ro: Ah! Austin: Ah! Ro: Ah-ah-ah! Austin:
OK, I get you.

Ro: This is the dirty work here because this
butter is at room temperature,

Ro: so it’s really soft. So your hands are
gonna get messy, that’s OK.

Ro: We’re gonna scoop in our shortening.
Austin: Scoop that in there!

Ro: Yeah! Alright, now Austin go in there
and just mix it up!
Ro: Now you’re gonna slowly add in the sugar.

Ro: So this is a two handed job. Austin: Yeah
it is. Ro: So you’re gonna pour

Ro: while you’re mixing. Austin: While I’m
mixing? Ro: Yeah. Austin: Wow.

Ro: And I’ll sit here and supervise! Austin:
That’s pretty intense!

Ro: You got it, you got it! You’re coordinated,
I know you can do it!
Ro: Yep!
Ro: What? A pro over here!

Ro: Now Austin is gonna add the extracts,
just pour ‘em both in there,

Ro: vanilla and almond. Austin: I’m gonna
fuze them at the same time.
Ro: Ahhhhh! Austin: Fuze!

Ro: Bellisimo! Austin: Boom! Ro: Now we are
gonna add our eggs, we’re gonna add

Ro: them one at a time, so I’m gonna have
you on mixer. Austin: Got it!

Ro: And then I’m gonna add the egg, and
then you’re gonna mix.

Ro: Here we go… Oh, oh my! Oh! Austin: Oh,
oh! Ro: OK go!

Austin: Don’t mess up this time! Ro: OK,
ready?
Ro: I got it, I got it, I got it!

Austin: That was probably your best one yet!
Ro: Thank you. Austin: Yeah.

Ro: Over here we’ve got our batter all mixed
up and here is half a cup of

Ro: 2% milk, and we are going to add just
the juice from the cherries,
Ro: until it reaches one cup.

Ro: Try not to get the cherries in there,
there you go.

Austin: Oh! We’re in the kitchen! It’s
OK, we’re in the kitchen!

Ro: It’s OK! Messes are delicious. Mistakes
are yummy! It’s OK!

Austin: You tell me when because I can’t
see where the cup is.
Ro: OK ready, set…. Now!
Ro: Boom!

Ro: We just did some Dirty Work, cleaned up
those cherries, and now, we’re gonna mix

Ro: everything together. So what we’re gonna
do here is we’re gonna alternate.

Ro: We’re gonna add a little bit of the
dry and the wet, to our butter mixture.

Ro: So we’re gonna start with a little dry,
ready? And then a little bit of wet.
Ro: Alright mix it up. Oh! Oh! Oh!

Ro: We have food all over us! Austin: We’re
just a mess in the kitchen!

Ro: Boom! Austin: Are we licking this thing?
Ro: Huh!
Ro: Yeah do you want to taste it?
Ro: Wait, I thought you were gonna…

Ro: It’s too sweet before it bakes. Austin:
No. Ro: Is it OK?
Austin: Mmmhmmm. Ro: OK.

Ro: We just finished making the batter and
we put it in these plastic bags,

Ro: and Austin’s got some scissors so we’re
gonna just snip tip.

Ro: We put them in here for a little bit more
control.

Ro: When you’re making mini cupcakes, it’s
a little bit harder to scoop

Ro: in your batter, so using a plastic baggie
is just an easy trick.

Ro: And then you’re gonna fill them about
half way to two thirds full.

Ro: Austin’s doing really good, and you
can make as many of these as you’d like.

Austin: You’re real slow over there. Ro:
I know! Oh my gosh!

Ro: Once you’ve filled your cupcake trays,
you’re gonna throw these in the oven

Ro: at 350 degrees and bake for about 11 minutes.
They’re a lot smaller so just
Ro: keep your eye on them.

Ro: Because they bake a lot faster than regular
cupcakes. Austin: Mmmhmm.

Ro: We just took the cupcakes out of the oven,
and they have had plenty of

Ro: time to cool, and now it is my favorite
time, time to decorate!

Ro: This is the fun part! So we’ve got a
little frosting in these bags with a

Ro: number ten tip, and are you ready? Austin:
Let’s do it!

Ro: I’m gonna show you how to frost a cupcake.
Austin: Alright, let me see.

Ro: Start in the middle. Austin: Oh start
in the middle? Alright.

Ro: Put a little pressure, and then you
go to the outside, and go all the way

Ro: around, make a circle all the way around,
and then work your way in! Boop!
Ro: Nice. Austin: Boop!

Ro: Now the next part is we’re gonna add
some little pink sprinkles on top.

Ro: This is just the little confetti, we’ve
separated them so that we’re just

Ro: using the pink sprinkles, and just sprinkle
them all over.

Ro: I call this the make it rain. Austin:
The make it rain?

Ro: Yeah, are you ready? I make it rain, I
make it rain!

Austin: Dirty Work! Daw-daw-daw, da-dee-dee-dee!
Daw-daw-daw, bop!

Austin: And for the last step we’re gonna
put a cherry on top. Ro: Mmmhmm!

Austin: So should we put a cherry on top?
Ro: Yeah. Austin: Let’s do it!

Ro: Little candy cherry, and just boop! Right
on top. Austin: Boop!

Austin: We’re putting cherries on top, yeah!
Ro: Boop!
Austin: Cupcakes, cherries on top, yeah!

Austin: We got pink icing. Ro: Boop-boop!
Austin: Pink sprinkles, pink icing,

Austin: pink sprinkles, putting the cherries
on top! Ro: Boop-be-doop-be-doop-be-doop!

Austin: Cherries on top, yeah! Ro: Boop-boop-be-doop!
Boop!
Both: Ta-da!

Ro: Here are our Mrs. Cake Cutie Mark Cupcakes
that we made today!

Ro: A big thank you to you guys for suggesting
something My Little Ponies,
Ro: And a big thank you to Austin!

Austin: Aw, thank you I appreciate it. Ro:
Thanks for helping me bake today!

Austin: Thank you for having me! Ro: This
was so much fun!

Ro: Again, I will be putting all of Austin’s
links down below, to his song

Ro: and social medias, so go, say hi, go check
him out. Austin: Go follow me! Ro: Yeah!

Ro: And, we’ll be posting lots of pictures
of the cute little Cupcakes that we

Ro: made today on Tumblr, Twitter, Facebook
and Instagram. And if you guys make

Ro: these, please take a picture and tweet
them to us! Austin: Yes! Please!
Ro: We would love to see your baking creations!

Ro: It just makes my day! I get a kick out
of it.
Ro: Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
